The paper deals with a computational problem related to data clustering, which is a topic in both theoretical computer science and machine learning. The problem involves computing centroids based on a specific distance metric, which is a common theme in computational geometry and algorithms. The paper also discusses complexity results and algorithms, which are typical topics in theoretical computer science and discrete mathematics. Therefore, the most likely sub-categories are cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms), cs.CC (Computational Complexity), cs.CG (Computational Geometry), cs.LG (Machine Learning), and cs.DM (Discrete Mathematics).
